messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: **Asteroids**, which are large rocks that fly through space, are called 'Potentially Hazardous' when they are close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth. NASA has created a map of 1,400 of these asteroids, but they do not believe any of them will be a danger in the next one hundred years. With the technology that is available today, NASA can follow these objects and predict if they might hit our planet. If this happens, two different defence plans could be used to protect us.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: The submission failed the Stage 1 Quantitative Metrics Check. The CEFR classifier determined the output text is at a B2 level, which does not match the target B1 level. This is a non-negotiable failure condition.
